author: Homer Simpson
title: Homer, I Hardly Knew Me
synopsis:
Woohoo! 'Homer, I Hardly Knew Me' is the story of me, Homer Simpson, the big guy with a heart of gold and a brain of... well, let's just say it's not my strong suit. I'm gonna take you on a wild ride through my life, from my days as a little Sprinfielder to my marriage to the most beautiful woman in the world, Marge.
 You'll hear about my many jobs, like when I was a safety inspector at the ol' nuclear plant, and my many, many mistakes along the way. I'll introduce you to my buds, like Barney, the world's best drinking buddy, and Ned Flanders, the neighborino who always seems to have it all together.
 And let me tell ya, being a dad ain't easy, but it's the best gig in the world. I'll talk about my amazing kids, Bart, Lisa, and Maggie, and how proud I am of 'em, even if they sometimes drive me a little nuts.
 But enough about them, let's talk about me! I love food, beer, and donuts more than anything, and I'm not ashamed to admit it. Sure, I've had my struggles with my waistline and some not-so-healthy habits, but that's all part of being a big guy like me.
 So grab a Duff, settle in, and get ready for some laughs and maybe even a tear or two. 'Homer, I Hardly Knew Me' is gonna be the best thing you read this side of Krusty Burger. Woo hoo!
